title: How to Make a Gluten Free Chocolate Sheet Cake

steps.headline: In a large bowl, mix the coconut flour, tapioca flour, sugar, soda, salt, and xanthan gum.
In the medium saucepan, melt the butter and then add the cocoa.
Whisk them together and then add water.
steps.description: Just bring it to a boil.

steps.headline: Pour the very hot chocolate mixture into the flour mixture.
Stir together very well.
steps.description: Once it has cooled off somewhat, add in the eggs and vanilla. If it isn't cooled off, the eggs will cook.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into a large, greased baking sheet.
Bake for about 15 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Melt the butter in saucepan over medium heat.
Add in the cocoa powder and stir it until it is smooth.
Add the milk, vanilla, and powdered sugar.
Add the chopped pecans and stir until they are thoroughly mixed in.
Pour the frosting over the hot cake.

text: Steps Preheat your oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  In a large bowl, mix the coconut flour, tapioca flour, sugar, soda, salt, and xanthan gum.  In the medium saucepan, melt the butter and then add the cocoa.  Whisk them together and then add water. Just bring it to a boil. Pour the very hot chocolate mixture into the flour mixture.  Stir together very well. Once it has cooled off somewhat, add in the eggs and vanilla. If it isn't cooled off, the eggs will cook. Pour the batter into a large, greased baking sheet.  Bake for about 15 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Icing Melt the butter in saucepan over medium heat.  Add in the cocoa powder and stir it until it is smooth.  Add the milk, vanilla, and powdered sugar. Stir. Add the chopped pecans and stir until they are thoroughly mixed in.  Pour the frosting over the hot cake.  Let cool.  Pour over hot cake.
